|Title=Know the definition of encephalic death
|Description=None
|Rubric=Definition
|Contributors=Dany Anglicheau
|Order=6}}

Encephalic death is the definitive and irreversible destruction of the brain.

It corresponds to a deep, reactive coma, with disappearance of all brain stem reflexes and absence of spontaneous breathing.

question.question: What is the primary characteristic of encephalic death?
question.option_a: Presence of brain stem reflexes and spontaneous breathing
question.option_c: Deep, reactive coma with disappearance of all brain stem reflexes and absence of spontaneous breathing
question.option_d: Temporary loss of consciousness with some brain activity
